intro: Eriogonum gossypinum, commonly known as the desert buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Eriogonum gossypinum plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small animals.
